content.description: The crux is getting onto the edge of the boulder. There’s a decent toe hold you can step up onto with your right foot and a sloppy crimp you can grab with your left hand to help center your balance onto the edge. From there it’s should he straight forward.
content.location: The best way to find Temple’s Garden is heading west towards the massive walls in Tomsich Butte. Across the river You should see two massive boulders leaning against themselves towards the larger walls. Temples Garden is directly adjacent to those leaning boulders. With photos you should be able to spot it.

content.description: Super fun boulder with lots of great holds! Lots of variety in terms of hold variation. May need some cleaning upon arrival. I recommend bringing a brush along. It’s not typically a climbing hot spot, but if you’re there it’s worth checking out.
content.location: In tomsich butte the best path to Jerry’s Jam is the white sand paths that lead North East towards the larger boulder that will be visible. Stick to the paths, lots of preserved soil in that area.
